page.title: 10Communications.
page.content: {The Radio Telephone.}There is no wire link between Lundy and the mainland -and use of the phone is not ordinarily avaliable to visitors.The only phones are in the office and in two houses(for emergencies).The standing charge is at present around Â£1000 per annum. {The Postal Service.}Mail is carried on the Polar Bear to Biddiford P.O. and a charge is made for this service on outgoing mail.Stamps have been issued since 1929.Mail used to carry British and Lundy stamps but in 1974 a franking machine was aquired and now the full cost is covered by Lundy stamps which are affixed on the left, leaving room for franking on the right. Some philatelists specialise in collecting Lundy stamps but nowadays not many commemoratives are issued. The income only helps to defray costs.
